title: How to Make a Gift Pouch from a Greeting Card

steps.headline: Cut the card along the crease or just in front of it.
steps.description: You will use just the front "cover" of the card for this project.

steps.headline: Measure the height of the card.
steps.description: Mark where you will score and fold it. One fold will create a short tab about 1/2" (1cm) long and the other fold will divide the remaining section into two equal parts. You can put the short tab either on the top or the bottom, so take a look at the design on the card and decide how you'd like it to line up on the finished pouch.

steps.headline: Score the card horizontally along the lines you just marked.
steps.description: You can use a nail or an empty ball-point pen to do this.

steps.headline: Fold along the score lines, as shown.
steps.description: The short end will create a tab. Fold the tab towards the inside.

steps.headline: Trace around the edge of a large, round object, such as a CD or the edge of a bowl or pot lid.
steps.description: Align the object so its edge is tangent to the edge of the card and so that the arc is centered. Do this to both ends of the folded tube.

steps.headline: Using the same object, score curves at each end.
steps.description: Score on both sides. Do not draw or cut these curves. Line the round object up so that it just meets each corner of the tube.Cut all the layers of the card along the curves you just traced.

steps.headline: Glue the open edge closed along the tab or use clear tape to close it.
Insert a small gift by opening the tube as shown.
Fold the ends in along the scored curves to hold the gift in place and finish the pouch.
Done.
steps.description: Your recipient only needs to unfold one end of the pouch to retrieve the gift.

tyn: Greeting card; choose a design suited to the occasion
Something to use to score the card: a knitting needle, a ballpoint pen that is out of ink, a nail, etc.
